edu.holycross.shot.abracadabra
[Groovy] Class CiteIndex

java.lang.Object
  edu.holycross.shot.abracadabra.CiteIndex

class CiteIndex

A simple class modelling a CITE Index, associating pairs of URN values. There are two components to the model: [1] an inventory, cataloging indices and defining RDF verbs for each direction of the paired relation, and identifying a data source; [2] a data source. This implementation uses local files * in either .tsv or .csv format both for the inventory and for the index data source.

Nested Class Summary
enum CiteIndex.RefType

Enumeration distinguishing CITE from CTS URNs, and distinguishing simple URNs from those with @-extended notation.

Method Detail

formatPair

static java.lang.String formatPair(java.lang.String urn1, java.lang.String urn2, java.lang.String verb, java.lang.String inverse)
Creates RDF string for a pair of URNs. If either URN includes an extended reference, includes RDF statements relating extended reference to unique object.
returns:
RDF TTL statements relating urn1 and urn2, or an empty String if urn1 or urn2 cannot be parsed.
Parameters:
urn1 - First URN, subject of main verb.
urn2 - Second URN, object of main verb.
verb - RDF verb for first relation.
inverse - RDF for inverse relation.

formatPair

static java.lang.String formatPair(java.lang.String urn1, java.lang.String urn2, java.lang.String verb, java.lang.String inverse, java.lang.Integer debug)

returns:
a RefType

Serializes all indices as RDF in TTL format.
Parameters:
outputFile - File where output will be written.
prefix - True if TTL prefix statements should be included.
